attributes.comment:
My family and the community of persons we know who have adopted
internationally and/or support international adoption, strongly oppose this
regulation to raise adoption-related fees and petitions. As international adoption is
a way to better the lives of children with literally no future in other countries, as
well as better the lives of those families with either the inability to have children of
their own or otherwise feeling the need to provide a future to a child, it is
inconceivable that this agency would further raise the cost of private families' own
satisfaction their basic human rights. Already couples and families are
discouraged and turned away because of the exhorbitant cost of adoption.
Adopting families provide the world community a service by converting the status
of a child from a numbered ward of the state, to that of a son/daughter and
brother/sister. The unadopted children, upon reaching maturity, will be left to their
own devices to provide for themselves or find a place of belonging. Without a
family those children will become futher burdens of the state through crime or
delinquency. In this world of terrorism, the US cannot assume that the
delinquency of another country does not affect our own lives. I would think that
the service provided by adopting families, already unrecognized, would not be
further discouraged by higher costs. Rather, the incentive of this agency, in this
rulemaking, should be to ease the funancial burden of families who are simply
seeking their own happiness and that of an orphaned child.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Rey
